config-rpm.script:
chkconfig --level 2345 mysqld on service mysqld restart > /dev/null
# set password - the logic below is to attempt to access the database # *without* a password. If we can, then we know we need to reset the password # and we do so. Otherwise, we assume the password has been correctly set # previously and we do nothing. if mysql -u root -e "SHOW DATABASES;" &>/dev/null; then mysql \ -u root \ -e "UPDATE mysql.user SET Password=PASSWORD('%{mysql-password}') WHERE User='root'; FLUSH PRIVILEGES;" fi
